title: Administrator In Training Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bismarck, ND) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1st phone call from Recruiter then 2nd step was Executive Director --virtual call then final step was with Senior Director-- virtual call as well. Always available for questions. There were emails and phone calls throughout the process.
Interview Questions: What is your Leadership style?

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy and convenient process and scheduling. Telephone interview with HR representative before meeting with department management and touring facility. Clear,step by step instructions for new hire on boarding. Travel and reimbursement and compensation for orientation.
Interview Questions: Describe a time and how you responded to an angry/unhappy patient.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: very professional! nice interviewers i enjoyed my experience. seemed to want to get to know me and i didn’t feel like just a number. took 45 minutes plus got a tour.
Interview Questions: when was a time you had conflict and how did you resolve it

title: HRIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. I had two calls in total. The first call was with the hiring manager and another analyst and second round was with Director. The questions were standard interview questions as to be expected. The call with the Director was very brief.
Interview Questions: Q. Tell us about yourself. Q. Tell me about a challenge or conflict you’ve faced at work and how you dealt with it.

title: Pathologist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Sent to screening interviews for positions I never applied for and that were well below education, experience and salary level. They will waste your time trying to fill positions you are over qualified for and there is no human contact, only text or email with no way to contact them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Called via telephone to set up interview, then I had to drive in to the hospital for the actual interview. The interview was not very long, and I was told I would be notified soon.
Interview Questions: What experience did I have

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Kind and Friendly Staff, Warm Relatable Informative Caring Easy to talk to. I am definitely looking forward to becoming a part of the team here, and all that it has to offer.
Interview Questions: Asked me about personal experience.

title: Care Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, screening telephone call by an HR representative and then in person interview with two supervisors within the department. Started as soon as my notice was up at my previous employer.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you you would do if a patient is not in agreement with a providers recommendation.

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone/online interview then had an in person interview with the management and part of the team.  Standard questions asking for examples of times I demonstrated certain skills and aptitudes.  Everyone was very friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that a project didn't go as planned.  What did you learn from the experience.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward questions and process. Respectful interactions with interviewers and other staff. The process was predictable overall.  Received a tour of the facility and introductions to some staff. Everyone was nice and welcoming
Interview Questions: How do you work as a team

title: Health Administration Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: The HR was very friendly and professional. I have applied for so many jobs at Sanford health and you always hear back from them with a decision regarding your application.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Robbinsdale, MN) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: filled out app on Indeed, got a email like a week later to set up a interview. The interview was in person on site for 2 days later. It not a easy interview. Mainly just talked a little about myself and what I was looking for in the job. They explained what the duties were . It was a very laid back interview.
Interview Questions: they didnt ask specific questions. Because we had a normal conversation and more questions she wanted to ask were in our normal conversations.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: It started with a phone interview. Then in person. The process was standard. Not anything out of the ordinary. It was a smooth easy process. The online application was easy too.
Interview Questions: What are your personal strengths.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy going. Business casual clothing was appropriate. Asked a few questions and they were pleasant. I denied the job though because pay was lower than I thought it would be
Interview Questions: Strengths and your weaknesses .

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple, I applied online and first went through recruiter phone screen and then interview with basic behavioral and get-to-know you questions. Did not speak with anyone other than recruiter
Interview Questions: The organization is an Evangelical Lutheran based org so they asked me about that and how my values aligned.

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to schedule an interview. When it was time to log in to my interview the first thing the interviewer says to me is " we didn't think you were coming". I was quite upset by that comment because I clearly was 3 minutes on time. How is that considered late? On top of that it wasn't very welcoming. I knew right then and there I wasn't going to get the job and why would I want to work for people like that.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: At the time most interviews were online which make it hard to answer questions and show any personality. Most interviews seemed very sterile. Could tell all questions were off of a very general script most times.
Interview Questions: Talk us through your relevant experience-in detail.

title: Biomechanics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: It was short and right to the point. Two interviewees PhD seeking engineers. I did most of the speakin about the background asked for and barely any questions. Online before COVID so maybe common
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with Viual3D and GAIT?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview really wasnt an interview more like a job offer with the director explaing what the job entails, benefits, and anything else. She'll answer all your questions and concerns you have.
Interview Questions: When can you start at Sanford?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward behavior questions and seeing if it would be a good fit with the corporate accounting team. They start out by telling you who’s on the team and what your role will entail on a day to day basis.
Interview Questions: Where do you see see yourself in 5 year

title: Learning and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Includes a traditional interview, a team interview, and a presentation.  Questions range from common interview questions to scenario-based questions and off the wall questions.  Presentation can be on any topic
Interview Questions: Favorite and least favorite part of current position, how do you build bridges with teammates in other states, how to adapt for virtual training

title: Administrative Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with HR rep and current Fellows. They asked a series of questions and left time for me to ask questions of my own. It was done over Webex.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were innovative?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a video interview (during Covid) and the clinic site wasn't really clear on what the schedule and responsibilities were going to be exactly. I asked a lot of questions and eventually figured out how they operated.
Interview Questions: What the soonest date I could start?

title: Physician Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application. I did pre-corded interview through a link. You need to record and submit the video within 3 business days. I just finished finished the interview and expect to hear something in five business days.
Interview Questions:
Why is this position?
Tell us about a time when you faced a difficult person.
Tell us about a time when you faced a problem before it got to serious.
What are the great and worst things about working in a team environment?
How do you adapt to change?
Do you have any salary requirements?
Why should we hire you?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions:
First interview - Pre screening with a recruiter
Second interview - Video meeting with two hiring managers - typical situational questions
Third interview - Face to face with hiring managers and their supervisor -  hypothetical exercise to determine competency.
Forth interview - Meeting with supporting department leaders to determine fit.
No response for three weeks. 
Overall process took 5 months.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Therapy Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Tour of the facility for one half of the interview the other half I interviewed with two managers (one physical therapist and the other speech therapist) in an office. The interview felt informal which threw me off a little bit. Overall it wasn't an intimidating nor a terrible experience.
Interview Questions: what interested you in this position?

title: Supply Chain Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview was behavioral, virtual, short, and smooth. It didn't take more than 30 minutes. And they email me back in a short time amount of time. The questions were very direct and nothing confusing.
Interview Questions: Describe me your three strengths.

title: Clinical Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Fair and relaxed process. First interview was teleconference and then second interview was in person. Interviewers were generally interested in listening to what I had to say. The whole process was smooth and was completed in just over a week from first interview to second interview.
Interview Questions: Describe past experience in regards to the position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Very quick process. 
In person interview scheduled within 1 week of applying. Interviewed with hiring manager, completed a tour of area. Very personal process. Felt very informal. Started in office area moved to depart to see space.
Interview Questions: 5 year goals, experience in clinicals (i am a new grad).

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions:
Normal interview questions 
Make sure to be certified. 
Interviewer was kind and respectful and the conversations flows easily.  Just be yourself and answer the questions as you see fit. Remember there are no wrong answers.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a resident problem?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: It was delightful. I am a interested in healthcare and Sanford Health is a well-run company. I felt Comfortable in the interview process and they were kind. I was hoping for the job, but did not get it.
Interview Questions: Where I am from and how that effected my life.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: I showed up to the interview and waited for two hours and no one showed up. They just left me waiting in the lobby and they wanted me to set up another interview time.
Interview Questions: They never asked me a question.

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was not professional, basic communication ethics were zero. I don’t know how he was hired, already got a sense as the interview continues that it’s micromanagement in the organization. They are wasting the interview process when their end goal is to hire somebody cheap on visa after seeing how the manager treats the interview person.
Interview Questions: Asked basic questions, job description was different than compared to interview. Pay was not even worth the technologies they want you to work on.  At one point, during interview, I understood i am not gonna work in this micromanaged and unprofessional environment.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview was about 45 minutes. It began with the interviewers explaining the position and team.  Then they asked me typical interview questions and left some time at the end of the interview for me to ask questions and have a more "conversational" type of interaction.
Interview Questions: How do I approach managing projects? Do I take a technical project management approach or focus more on developing relationships with project teams?

title: IT Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by managers of it department and we talked about what is expected during the summer and different roles that would be filled. Very welcoming and polite to any and every questions asked
Interview Questions: What is your experience in this field

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The initial scheduling process was very disorganized and they seemed unsure of the location. I applied for three different roles and was told that I’d be interviewed for the full-time role in a week. I was shocked to get a generic rejection email two weeks after, all the time I’d been prepping for another round of interviews. Pay scale is okay but on the lower end. One of the roles required a lot of expertise for only a temporary position.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this role?

title: Research Compliance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted in a very informative, conversational manner. This was one of the least stressful interviews I have experienced. It is very helpful to be precise in your answers and also to ask for clarification if needed on a question.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a situation in which you had to accomplish multiple tasks in a confined time period.

title: Claims Examiner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Initially I interviewed by phone with HR. It was a typical screening interview to make sure you meet qualifications. Then I interviewed with the department manager. Process took approximately 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience /medical background? What type of teammate are you?

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Terribly unimpressed. 

I applied for (3) separate roles. I was offered interviews for all three. 

For the first role, I spoke directly with one of the Hiring Managers within HR. The interview ended with a promise that I would be getting a call and/or email from him sometime in the next week regarding next steps. I followed up with a “Thank You” email expressing continued interest in the position. I never got a reply, and received a auto-generated email notification a few weeks later that the role was being paused or cancelled. 

For the second role, I received a request to self-schedule a Phone Screen. I spoke with a low-energy/enthusiasm Recruiting representative a few days later, which ended with a candid disclosure (which I appreciated) that my earnings history would likely rule me out for the position. From conversations with other employees at Sanford, and based on my pre-call research, I knew compensation would be a challenge to overcome. Their target salary for the role was about 45% my previous. My only lingering question— why wasn’t salary wasn’t discussed in the first 60 seconds, to save 30 minutes of my (and the employee’s) time and energy? 

For the third role, I received a request to auto-schedule a Phone Screen, and was asked to complete a web-based (video) short answer component. I spoke with another Recruiting representative two days after the video portion. The format was structured, timed, and did not allow for rapport-building. Though it went well, there seemed to be some dead air on the other end of the phone when we discussed my earnings history. I was told I would be updated about next steps shortly. Regardless, I still sent a “Thank You” email expressing continued interest in the position.  I received an auto-generated email notification a few days later that I was no longer under consideration.    

According to another review I read from a HR candidate, it sounds like my experience was par for the course at Sanford.  Their vetting process is extremely mechanical and cold, and meant to keep candidates at a distance.  Typical Shared Services high-volume “assembly line Recruiting” based in metrics/data (and likely, micromanagement). And although they use an ATS, it appears they do not communicate/coordinate well. I answered the same half dozen questions repeatedly.  Apparently, at Sanford, they believe they are living in a buyer’s market, and prospects are little more than a candidate number, a body. It seems to be a common theme from the employee reviews I read, which hint at high levels of attrition. Which is strange considering the CEO is the former Chief People Officer. You’d think that HR professionals would treat fellow HR professionals with more warmth. At the very least, you’d expect them to understand that the impressions candidates are left with (the “candidate experience”) are likely to be shared directly with other potential candidates, and on platforms such as Glassdoor. I will not apply a fourth time, and will advise contacts of mine to pursue opportunities with their competition here in town.
Interview Questions:
Q:  Based on the job description, do you feel qualified to perform the duties as outlined?

Q: What are you long-term career goals? 

Q:  Do you have a target in mind in terms of compensation?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: After the application, they will send you a video recording questionnaire of yourself. There are about 10 questions involved. This is the first step. I have not gone past this, but be ready to answer what past roles you were involved with and why they helped.
Interview Questions: What past experience will help you in this role?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: First round was video, they gave you questions and you recorded your answers. Next step was in person. Process was great and the people were easy to work with. Only downside was having to write a press release at the end of the interview. I didn't not account for the time it would take and had to rush.
Interview Questions: Average interview questions, what are your strengths? How do you work with others? What interested you in the company? It was laid back and the people were interviewed were all very nice.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly.  Easy going, clinical questions. Explanation of  the schedule and first year of working as well as its benefits. Dress code. Day and night shift.  Interdisciplinary work ethic with nurses, RTs, and practitioners
Interview Questions: Why did you become a respiratory therapist

title: Biomechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first round was a one-way interview through a link where you recorded your responses and it was added to your application. I was rejected after the first round. The hiring process was slow and it took a long time to receive a response from them
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?
Customer-service based questions

title: Senior Leadership Development Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: I have never been treated better by a potential employer. The process was transparent, fair and the people are extremely welcoming and friendly. I wish I could have excepted their offer as they seem like a great organization to work for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Sanford?

title: Human Resources/Change Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I've completed interviews for 3 positions with Sanford in the last 6 months -- one phone interview, two live video interviews, and two on-demand video interviews -- and there was no follow-up by Sanford after the interviews until I initiated contact with them.  In other words, I interviewed with 3 people from Sanford, and no one bothered to follow-up with me to let me know that I was not moving forward. I have no problem if it was decided not to move forward with me, but have the professional courtesy to initiate follow-up  with the candidate.
Interview Questions:
There is a set of standard questions for all the on-demand video interviews for Sanford positions:
- Tell us about your work history and why you are applying for the job

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bismarck, ND) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received a phone interview with recruiter a few weeks later, skype interview with clinic supervisor one week after the recruiter call, in person interview and clinic tour, official offer received via email.
Interview Questions: How do you learn? What are your strengths and weaknesses? What would you do if.... (situation)?

title: ITSpecialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: They didn't really ask me all that many questions. First you get a call to screen you and see if you would like a real interview. If you accept they will give you an interview and its as basic as it comes.
Interview Questions: Do I want to work in this position

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Blue Bell, PA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted online resume.
Fully electronic video interview with no human video. You video yourself answering questions. You had 3 tries. I did it for the experience,  but really think they are treating applicants like robots. I can't imagine how they treat customers.
Interview Questions: All questions were at top of screen and you had a countdown of a minute to prepare answer and 2 minute to video yourself giving the answer.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: -During Covid -15-30 minutes -A little intimidating It was a little intimidating being in a hospital setting for the first time, but as the interview went on, it became clear that this was an employee orientated work-sphere. I was interviewed during a time of masks, so it was hard gaging body language to go along with words.
Interview Questions: -How my past experience in healthcare can help me move Sanford forward?

title: Social Media Stratgeist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: First did a video interview and then did an in-person interview with several people from the organization. They were friendly and the interview process went smoothly. The followup after the interview did not take long.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Logistics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, mostly wanted to know about ability to work in a team dynamic, as well as ability to work independent from others. Big emphasis on work ethic and being a depenable indivdual who is on time.
Interview Questions: What are you most proud of?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful. It was via video. Met with entire team. Was an awesome opportunity, but could not take due to location. Would highly recommend. Overall, the organization was well thought out, well planned, and covid conscious.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the position.

title: Interface Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Usually theres two stages of interview takes place for most of the positions. First onecould be phone-screening or on-site and second one's on-site. Interviews are conducted by Managers mostly with the presence of Lead Engineers
Interview Questions: Greatest strengths?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bismarck, IL)
Interview Descriptions: You apply, HR will contact you later if they are interested. You'll have to do a brief phone screening, and then they'll forward your application to the hiring manager for that department.You set up an interview, and then interview. If they are intrested they'll call you with an offer!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Sanford?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Called within a week to set up a time. Went in to find two people asking a series of common questions. The overall hiring process I heard is long convoluted and they aren't forthcoming with information.
Interview Questions: How I would react to someone arguing with me

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and cover letter,  if selected, screening interview by HR and then second interview conducted by hiring manager or panel of interviewers. Additional interviews may be required depending upon role or department.
Interview Questions: Role based questions and questions about strategy for role

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick and to the point. They describe the job to you and you ask questions along the way. At the end if you have questions ask them. They get back to you very quickly.
Interview Questions: What area of care are you interested in the most and why?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Met one-on-one with the department supervisor. Interview process low key, friendly and welcoming.  The interview itself was an average interview with questions ranging from the typical get-to-know-you questions to "how would you handle certain situation" questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: phone screen and then the in person interview. it was a very casual interview. we went over my experience and resume. then gave me a tour of the floor i would be working at.
Interview Questions: why did i want to work there?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Kuna, ID) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite seamless. I actually discovered this position through an online career fair which was sponsored by the university I am attending. I spoke with one of their current talent acquisition specialists, he was very informative, cordial, and answered any and all questions I had. After submitting my application, it only took about a week after the job posting closed for their team to contact me and set up a date and time for an interview via Skype. There were a couple of so-called "softball" questions at the beginning, but after that, their questions really made me have to think on my feet and weren't just simple to answer. After the interview was complete, I waited for about a month before Sanford contacted me and offered me another position within the same department, which they said could happen during the interview. All in all, the interview process has been one of the more pleasant processes I've been through. I've applied to jobs where I never received any emails, phone calls, or information regarding my application status. Pleasantly surprised by their process.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to resolve a conflict between two other co-workers or subordinates?

title: Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Benton, AR) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I have had two interviews for this position. One was a phone interview. I had a second interview which wa on Skype for businss. I have not heard back yet from the interviews. As this is a new position and they are still interviewing for this position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions:
I spoke with the manager for the department. It was a conversation and not the typical structured interview format. The interviewer was so comfortable he even cursed during the interview.  The use of profanity is unacceptable. The interview was scheduled for 30 minutes, but went to an hour.  
NEGATIVE RATING ...... If the candidate is not meeting your criteria, then the interview should end at the scheduled time.  This is misleading and quite humiliating for the job applicant.
Interview Questions: Questions based on the experience from resume.

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Albuquerque, NM) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from talent acquisition representative to set up a 45 minute Skype interview. A week after, the director of the department called me on Skype and he was much interested to know if I require visa sponsorship. When I said yes, he lost interest and rushed to close up the interview. Throughout the interview, he seemed uninterested and unprofessional and also took breaks in between. How come an interviewer never look at the visa sponsorship spot in the job application before they invite candidates for an interview?
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Emails, phone call, and an in person interview. Interview process was quick and they responded almost immediately. Overall a decent and easy interview. 3 other people were in the room
Interview Questions: What are your experiences that would help you in this position?

title: Histotech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average. The usual 1 on 1 interview with questions and answers based on experience and background information. After the application, I got a call back for an interview within a week. The interview lasted about 30mins to 45 mins. Got an offer within the week. All in all, a pretty straightforward and fast/average interview process.
Interview Questions: Experience and Background information that makes me a good fit for the job

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Not a very organized interview or orientation process. Orientation did not share a lot of useful information for a new hire from outside the organization and I am still trying to figure many things out at this point in my employment there.
Interview Questions: What do you have to offer this organization?

title: Employee Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was at professional building in Sanford. Interviewed for half an hour, the questions were very good, open-ended personal questions. Interviewers work in the department and are very friendly and personable. Interview was supposed to be three interviewers but two were sick, so it was a one-on-one interview which made it less intimidating.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this position?

title: Senior Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online in late August and did my first phone screen in late September, followed by an in-person panel interview with two separate groups in mid-October. I didn't find out until mid-November that  I had not been selected, which is an incredibly long time to wait. Furthermore, never once did salary come into the talks -- I asked for this information after I had found out (because I went looking for feedback) I had not been selected. 

What was good: Meeting a variety of folks -- the interview questions themselves were quite sound. Also, they paid mileage for traveling from out-of-town.

What could be better with their process: Telling candidates a salary range as to not waste job candidates and interviewers' time, speeding up the process or at least checking in and saying why things were taking so long. This was disappointing. I had already assumed the result, but I wish employers would just be better about this in general. Says a lot about a company, really.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you are working on right now to improve your performance at work?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online,  and was sent an email about setting up a phone interview.
A week or so later I had a phone interview with the hiring manager 30-40 minutes. I was then sent a question sheet from one of the employees on the team which I filled out and sent.  Maybe one or two weeks later I got a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: Pretty typical interview questions, tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself in five years, etc.

title: Cardiac RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was very smooth when going through the phone interview with HR, setting up the interview with the nurse manager, and meeting with her in person at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then recieved a phone call from the supervisor asking me to come in for a quick in-person interview and then the day after the interview I received a job offer
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Sanford?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with the hiring manager.  Was told about the position, hours and other requirements. Had an opportunity to ask questions.  Also received a tour of the unit. Very laid back interview.
Interview Questions: What could you contribute to this unit?

title: One Connect Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: The Dept Director and RN Manager who did the interview were so comfortable to talk to that I almost forgot I was in an interview. They were professional but very conversational-in a way that just eased my nerves and made me feel like I belonged there!
Interview Questions: They did not ask me a single "stock" interview question like every other place does. Not a single one. Guess there is a first time for everything!

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process included submitting a resume and cover letter through the career page, video conference interview, and in-person interview.  The interviews began at the executive level and hiring manager, followed by panel interviews with coworkers and direct reports.
Interview Questions: Define your leadership style.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Jackson, MN) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received word back quickly. It began with an initial phone interview that last 6 minutes, then I proceeded to an in-person interview at the hospital. A great overall experience with just the manager in the room during the interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a disagreement with a co-worker? How did you handle it?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: applied online through the company website, scheduled a primary phone interview that went well, then had a secondary in person interview.  I did not take the job because the salary was too low
Interview Questions: What type of work environment do you prefer to work in?

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Was called based on a resume I submitted. Scheduled a time and date for me to come in and meet with the department manager. The interview lasted about 45 minutes. The lady was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Standard questions.

title: Associate Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It comprised of a tour of the facility and meeting everyone associated with the lab I was interviewing with. Then, I would have a one on one with the primary researcher in her office.
Interview Questions: How do handle contamination issues?

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Online application with an in person interview with the unit manager. The manager greeted me in the lobby and gave me a brief tour of the main hospital areas. Then we went to her office and she asked me questions while looking over my resume. Once the interview was over she gave me a tour of the unit and introduced me to a few nurses. A charge nurse gave me a tour of the unit and answered my questions. Then I was walked down to the lobby after the interview. Within four days I was contacted by HR and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you experienced conflict with a co-worker and how you handled it

title: Cytotechnologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First, I was contacted by the HR department. Then, moved on to the on-site interview with the slide tests. After I got contacted by HR department, it was not that long.

As a potential cytotechnologist, slide tests are always there.
Interview Questions: What was your weakness, and how and what did you do to overcome your weakness

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was two weeks from when I submitted application online to when they contacted me to schedule a face-to-face interview.  The interview itself was very relaxed and informal.  60 minutes.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in billing or invoicing?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got a text from Sanford stating that I got an interview, I had to call HR to set a day and time. I got an email verifying my day and time for the interview and the address to which I was being interviewed at.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your past.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was ok, I've been denied by this job so many times, I have all the qualifications but been denied constantly, I've applied for other customer service jobs and yet still being denied I just feel its a race thing and not because of my qualifications
Interview Questions: How did you find this job?

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Albany, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Good overall, prompt followup and meetings. They could improve the communication process and it took very long time to get the feedback. The company is good and the questions were easy.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself

title: Customerservice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screen first through Human Resources. Then met 2 additional times for separate interviews. Then offered position with a follow up email from human resources with details. I asked for more information regarding benefits and Human Resources provided some additional documents for me to review.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview within a couple of weeks of applying for the position. I had a face-to-face interview, followed by about a two week wait because of the Thanksgiving holidays. I then received a request for second interview with the director and VP of the department. Both interviews went really well, and I felt I would receive an offer. Following the interview, I sent a thank you note. A week later I followed up on the status of the position and was told they hired someone else. I inquired as to any feedback they can provide, and was told that I probably fell within the category where internal candidates had also applied. I was also told that they like to promote from within as much as possible. If this is truly the case, then why was the position posted outside the company versus trying to fill internally first? Very frustrating when you’re trying to gain employment and you can’t even get your foot in the door.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience managing customer service employees.

title: Insurance Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone prescreen.  Then an in person interview.  Both were very comfortable. I was interviewed by a manager and a director, both very courteous.  We discussed job duties and skills needed for the position.
Interview Questions: How would a previous supervisor describe you?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the company website. Got a call in 5 days for a phone interview. I was informed it would last for a half hour and my interview last for 10 mins including all the questions I have asked. I was informed if I got selected will get a call and if rejected I will get an email but I did not understand how and why it went wrong. Never received anything further than that.  When I checked online, it shows my application has closed status.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for Sanford?
Tell me about your education and experience?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty good and fair. questions were understandable and relatable. no unnecessary questions were put out. small room and a panel of at least 5 or 6 people. they were quite friendly.
Interview Questions: What do you think about being patient-centric?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD)
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled a phone interview to ensure expected wage range. I was asked to attend an in-person interview with dept director and team member. Very comfortable, relaxed environment during the interview, instead of asking a lot of questions we just had a conversation regarding my qualifications. I was told that they would be doing a second interview next, however was offered another position before they scheduled it. I withdrew from this position.
Interview Questions: What does success mean to you?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND)
Interview Descriptions: My  application was submitted with resume. Was contacted and completed a face to face interview with department heads.  It took about 3 days to hear back from department head at which time I received an offer of employement.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the website for multiple positions, not particular picky about where I would be placed. HR called in a couple weeks to set up an interview time. I interviewed for the ARU and medical floor. Even though I interviewed for the medical floor they placed me on tele which I was fine with. They then set up times with me to meet with employee health and HR to establish my direct deposit and social security validation, etc. Then there was about a week of company training, 3 weeks of on the job training, and then I was working independently. It was nice that you jump right into the Sanford pay cycle, you don't have to wait 3 weeks for a paycheck.
Interview Questions: If you were ambulating a patient in the hall and looked into a room to see another patient who is a fall risk attempt to get up and start to fall, what would you do?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: A skype group call that lasted about an hour followed by a site visit that lasted two days, including two presentations on future and current research, during which I visited with pretty much everyone in the research group.
Interview Questions: How I could contribute to the research team - what new ideas do I have?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Promised a positive working experience, but failed to deliver on their word. The interview went smoothly and with out any issues or concerns. Honestly I thought it was very well performed
Interview Questions: How long have you been a nurse and what was your most difficult challenge.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming, and concerning individual who gave my interview. She was very friendly and was more focused on who I was as a person and felt immediately that I was apart of the team and she cared for me.
Interview Questions: What are some things you like to do in your social life?

title: Business Intelligence Report Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with department managers.  Then an In-person interview with the same people in addition to a 2 hour test.  I received an offer 4 days after the in person interview, but the offer was    much lower than the national average for that job title, and nowhere close to what I stated as a minimum requirement on my application.
Interview Questions: What are the first 3 things you will do on your first day of work?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, setup an interview by phone. I was interviewed by the department director and a supervisor.  Both very nice people. I sent a thank you note and got a call less than a week later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: what can you tell us about yourself?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online 
Got a call from HR for on site interview
In person interview with team of Manager/ supervisor and lead with regular behavioral questions. Asked to write e-mail why are you interested in job.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself, qualities of supervisor

title: MSW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for a MSW internship and received a call back 2 days later from their HR department to have a follow up phone screen interview. I was first informed that there were two open MSW internships for the upcoming semester. I was then told that since I did not attend UND's for my graduate degree that they would be unable to give me an interview most likely.  HR informed me that they had a "contract" with UND to use UND graduate students prior to outside institutions being allowed to apply. If there were no UND students applying for a certain semster, then internships would be opened up to students from other institutions. There was no merit based system in place and after I pointed out the lack of screening applicants on qualifications was unethical the HR rep became evasive and stated that I would receive a call back. 
When I received a call back it was from the HR rep's supervisor who stated that there were no MSW internships available for the upcoming semester. This was a blatant lie as the previous worker had told me differently and was not in trouble for divulging unethical company practices.
Interview Questions: What college do you currently attend?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Communication was not as good as I was hoping through for the entire process, I would have liked to know more of what was happening throughout the process.  The hiring manager did not have as much knowledge of the hiring process as I would have hoped.  I was deferred to the HR team to answer benefit and PTO questions
Interview Questions: What interests you in this position

title: Compensation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews for an entry-level position - seemed excessive. It took several weeks for the team to coordinate and get back to me with interviews at each step of the process. They were easy and the receptionist was extremely kind and helpful!
Interview Questions: Strength and comfort with Excel; questions regarding working in a team environment, attention to detail, communication style - pretty generic questions, didn't really give me a clear picture of what the position entailed

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I completed an in-person interview with the department manager. It was a very smooth process -- no surprising questions. I was offered a position within the next week, but politely declined.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? Weaknesses?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted after preliminary interview at a job fair and did one onsite interview.
First- HR recruiter 
Scenario questions, answer honestly with a little consideration about what you think they want you to hear, i.e. values and patient centered.
Second- two managers

Pretty straight forward- one unique question was Why I chose this internship over a full-time job. Other than that, most were your typical personality, experience questions. They spent a lot of time telling about the job you would be in rather than grilling you.
Interview Questions: Typical experience/background questions

title: Medication Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Dell Rapids, SD)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and filled out the application. Met the manager that same day. I was called for interview within a few days time, the manager interviewed me person to person. We mostly visited about the duty responsibilities, she asked a few questions and then offered me the position in 3 days.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you have problems or concerns with a co worker

title: Clinical Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a 30 minute phone interview with management, followed by a panel interview at a later date.  After the interview a test was given to show analytical skills.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress

title: Mlt Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Alexandria, MN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very prompt. I applied and the next day I was interviewed. The most difficulty was applying online. After I was hired and went to Fargo for initial training I had to go to their office and get help with parts of my application. It took longer than I expected to be hired. I applied for the part-time opening, but there was a former Sanford employee that also interviewed and she was offered the position. They did, however, offer me a casual position, which I actually like better. The only draw back to that is you receive no benefits. I had worked at the Clinic years before it became a Sanford Clinic, so I knew a few ladies in the lab so that helped ease me back into my former job!  It's so much fun working there again!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy 5 minute interview talked about ourselves and what we did last weekend.  Asked why I wanted the job.  She gave me a tour of the unit.  That was it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bismarck, ND) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Went to HR, met with head nurse. I dressed professionally and brought my resume.
Besides the standard questions, they were curious about my hobbies. As if it would interfere with work? I am married and they are supportive in times of family crisis. I appreciated that. Although, of course, they are a hospital. Except what would you expect?
Interview Questions:
They had me sign a non-disclosure agreement.
I can say, my friend who starting working there before me. Says, in the daily email, there is a lot of hiring, left the company, moved to different position, and even though my friend would not say. It is hard to tell, they are paying their staff enough. That is the usual reason, nurses and doctors don't always hang around.

title: Switchboard Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: You submit an application online and are then telephoned by and HR rep asking to schedule a telephone interview. After your telephone interview, you do a sit down interview with the department head you would be working for, after several days HR calls again to make you an offer of pay and to go over the hours/commitment.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this job?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview and was then scheduled for an in-person interview. I met with a manager and we discussed my experience as well as the expectations of the job.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Organized, manager had questionaire to complete with interview questions. Used Skype - quick and easy. Had a 2nd interview with coworker - same questions. Received offer, negotiated more. HR professional provided the offer and submitted the counter for me. Received word back within 5 days.
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with conflict?
What 3 words best describe you?

title: Helpdesk Support Spec Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted by an HR lady. She asked me about my salary expectation and told me that it was on higher end but they can work with me. She went ahead and scheduled me an interview at Fargo. It wasn't a hospital setup, it was rather a completely IT environment. I was interviewed by a lady and a guy. Interview was pretty smooth, all basic IT situation specific and some behavioral questions. Nothing out of the ordinary. 

I was contacted the following week and they offered me the position but tried to play low ball on me. Offered me 20% lower salary than what I discussed with the HR person. I reminded her about our initial conversation and she said I can counter offer. I did place a counter offer which Sanford didn't take. And eventually I turned down the offer.

Overall, it was a rather bad experience and I felt the HR lady was incompetent to call me for an interview if my expectation didn't match their budget. Wasted my time and theirs too. I'll think twice before applying to Sanford again.
Interview Questions: Described several helpdesk situations and asked me how I'd react to those.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called very quickly. Scheduled interview within 2 weeks. Was only with one other person, a clinical care supervisor of that unit.  Questions were mostly about problem solving with other co-workers and why I am more suited for this job than other applicants
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a problem with your co-workers work ethic or effectiveness.

title: Applications Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just a one interview process. Lasted about an hour. Two people were interviewing me. Interview questions applied directly to the job description points. A lot of the questions pertained to using examples from previous job experiences and how I used my critical thinking skills and problems solving abilities. Came prepared with a few examples of using critical thinking skills in my internship and that helped me answer most of the questions. Pretty straightforward and not that difficult.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Sanford?

title: Patient Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went to the department and was interviewed by a nurse who runs the department.  He explained what they do in the dept and showed me around and talked about the procedures they do there. Then we went to his office and he explained the job and asked me questions about my job experience and how I handled certain situations in my past jobs.   He asked if I had any questions quite a few times.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position, explain how I would handle an upset patient.  Asked if I had questions.

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: First Round: Telephone, Second Round: Information Session about the job , mostly behavioral round.Third Round: Technical Program written exam.Fourth Round: Technical Round with panel. Sanford IT team more concentrates on your program skills for the position. The overall experience was good. But lot of days taken to get call for the next level rounds.
Interview Questions: Project Experience - Mostly questions on your technical experience which you have performed in the project

title: Live Learn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Required a basic resume with two letters of recommendation.  Once reviewed, I got an email offering for an interview, over the phone or over Skype.  Interviews were very personable and straight forward. Interview process was very flexible in terms of choosing a time that worked for everybody.  Questions were not over the top.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to persevere through a tough time?

title: Quality Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was via video messaging/Skype. At first it was difficult getting used to talking into a  computer screen, but the technology worked well and the interviewers were very nice and professional. I showed up 20 minutes early for the interview, but I wasn't attended to until the exact time of the scheduled interview. The interview was about 35 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe the perfect job

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bemidji, MN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for multiple open RN positions. I ended up being offered one I had never applied for, but was a good fit for me. I interviewed with 2 managers of different units. I have also interviewed for a position change, that experience was informal and laid back.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you have shown courage in your career.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
You get a call from HR
You go to an interview where they will ask you basic interview questions. There is a focus on customer service. 
Each interview is different depending on leadership
Interview Questions: Why Sanford?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview. Easy to do, asked good questions. Were good at communicating via   email about the whole process. Very friendly and welcoming. Helped me feel relaxed during the process .
Interview Questions: How much do you know about Sanford ?

title: Claims Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview lasted an hour, the hiring manager was friendly and social. Some questions seemed a little strange but I guess they had recently had to clean house a bit, as they had some previous employees who had displayed some deeply inappropriate behavior. When the interview ended she said she would follow up with me within a week, but it actually took a month because human resources took their time approving my pay rate.
Interview Questions: How you would handle conflict within your team, whether you would handle it on your own or involve your manager.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online and included my up to date resume and a well thought out cover letter, highlighting how my knowledge and experience could be beneficial to them. A week later, I received a call for an interview from HR. They negotiated a starting pay and set a date for my interview. The interview was about 40 minutes. I was asked pretty standard interview questions by the unit manager. I was also asked questions about how I would handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: What relevant experience do you have?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Before I applied online, I was able to receive an internal reference and, as a result, I was introduced to the hiring manager. Afterwards, I was scheduled for an interview within the week.  When I was called by HR for a phone interview, I explained that I politely explained that I was actually on my way to a mock interview and they scheduled me for my interview with the hiring manager on the spot. The interview went well and the hiring manager seemed to be impressed. During the next month, I reached out a few times via email and finally with a phone call. The hiring manager returned my phone call, in-person, explaining my close contention and expressed interest with me and I applied for another position within the department. After two more interviews, I accepted another position within the same department and met the highly qualified candidate (internal applicant with much greater experience). I believe networking with previous departmental employees and current non-departmental employees gave me a great advantage.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to be in 10 years?

title: Sanford Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applying took the most time, but was overall easy. I did it on my cell phone, which was nice! Got a call to interview within 2 weeks, went in and met with 2 HR folks, 1 week later I got the offer!
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and how it relates to the position?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online and submitted resume & cv with that. I received a call from HR about 2 weeks after to schedule a phone interview and in-person interview. 1/2 hour phone interview with HR. Then 1 hour interview with clinical nurse managers from department.
Interview Questions: They asked "typical" interview questions for the 1st half hour (just google nursing interview questions). The 2nd half-hour was all about physiology and patient scenario questions (hard!). I think that it depends on the department you're going to interview for and possibly how short they are for nurses at the time of your interview.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: HR is slow to respond. First you have a telephonic interview by HR then one with the supervising managers. May need to come back and re-interview if they have several candidates in mind.
Interview Questions: "Why should we hire you"

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied through their web program. After 3 weeks, I got a call from the RN recruiter to set up interview times ( as I had applied for 2 different units ). Prior to meeting with the specific units, I had to meet with the RN recruiter at a different location to fill out paperwork. Then I drove downtown for my interviews. If I hadn't had all of my college clinical experiences at this facility, I think it would have been very difficult for me to get to where I needed to go as there wasn't anyone around to lead me.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was in regards to how I spend my time outside of work. They unit I was interviewing on apparently was very social and everyone enjoyed going to the bar after work, even it if was only 8 AM. I should have known then that they only way to enjoy this job was to drink. A lot.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Standar interview process had a phone interview with HR and met with the manager who asked standard interview questions and reviewed my resume.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was called to go in for an interview, was later called in for a second interview-usual questions: why should I hire you, tell me about yourself, what makes you want to work here etc etc. then was sent to Hr for drug test, then to enroll in the system to get orientation set up.
Interview Questions: usual questions: why should I hire you, tell me about yourself, what makes you want to work here etc etc

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was rocky at first.  I was told it was an hourly position at $ 13 per hour but upon further review it was salary.  When I was promoted it was a great increase.
Interview Questions: How do you react to issues?

title: Environmental Services/Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: After the submission of the application to work at Sanford, I got a phone call from the HR department up at Sanford, wanting to set up a time for me to have a face to face interview. However, I was not available at that time, I was in school. So, the HR was flexible, and had a phone-interview session with me. It went pretty well. The good part was, they were looking for individuals who are dedicated to work in the perspective of quality than quantity. The culture up at Sanford was lenient and nice! It is a fast-paced workplace. Overall, the phone interview with the HR department went well as expected.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was, what is your philosophy and how would you contribute to Sanford. Something like that got me thinking about the hospital and how I can contribute in order to make the workplace and the patients feel welcomed!

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health
Interview Descriptions: Online search engine site through Sanford's website, create online profile and fill out application; after application is filled out email will be received thanking you for applying to Sanford and that they will contact you for an interview if you are considered for the position.  If you are not considered, and email might be received anywhere from 1-6 months after applying (personal experience).  Usually an interview call will be 2+ weeks after application is received.  Initial phone interview with HR, if pass that then set up interview with specific department and some departments then have a "peer interview."
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with a supervisor and tell me the outcome.

title: Surgical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and then wait for a phone call from HR.  You will interview with HR and then the OR director or manager.  It seemed that HR and the OR did not communicate because it felt like duplicate interviews.  My interviews where held on different days.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions along with some questions about your past as a surgical tech.

title: Director of Clinic Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: HR process is improving.  Years ago it look a long time to get the resumes to the department but it has improved.  Resumes are submitted online and then reviewed by HR.   The HR team is becoming a much more qualified department. The interview was done at the clinic in the presence of the physicians and the department VP.  They asked relevant questions but also asked a few personal questions, which I didn't mind.
Interview Questions: HR does an initial interview and then passes them along to the department.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bismarck, ND) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by department manager. Very professional and comfortable. Was called back the next day and offered the position.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child was crying and the parent was in the room but was sleeping.

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Sioux Falls, SD) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty intense.  I had phone interview, human resource interview and interview with managers and human resources.  The interviewers were very friendly though which made it a great experience.
Interview Questions: Give you a test for coding

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sanford Health in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process takes forever. They drill you with questions. The lady who interviewed me was a robot.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you received an award

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were thorough and detailed, they asked for 3 references from previous employers and background checked, which is pretty  much standard for any job. I had meetings with executives and also people who would be potentially working with me, people are known for being nice in North Dakota and this was true in my case.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Fargo, ND) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview that went well...hired at the time of an acquisition.  Made to believe I would have the same hours but pay raises were dependent upon the companys choice, not on merit.
Interview Questions: What are your goals.

title: RN Float Pool Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sanford Health (Bemidji, MN) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: HR department was very nice and supportive. The interview was very personal and friendly. I was called back in a few weeks. They liked me most because I acted calm and natural. They prefer 4-year RNs for the float pool. They liked that I was already ACLS and PALS certified.
Interview Questions: Who's your role model and why?
